file_content.text: Outplaying Raklann at his own game. Quite marvelous; well done.
The Voss are greatly pleased by what you've done. Meet with Major Kouvar at Pelath Point. Raklann's time has come.
Speak with Captain Ortano concerning the threat to the Voss. And see that the Gormak chieftain pays for his crime.
Ah. Back, not a moment too soon. But first--excellent work securing the ruins. Our reclamation teams were able to do a proper survey.
They confirmed my suspicions: Raklann found an ancient, forgotten Sith device, and used it to adapt his weapons.
Without that device, Raklann has lost his advantage. We can finally turn our attention to crushing that... beast, before he does any further damage!
Did you learn what this device was for?
What was this device?
It was one of many we found in a crumbling Sith laboratory. All destroyed now. Wonders cannibalized for spare parts by a monster!
Forgive me. Matters have escalated in your absence.
You seem agitated. Why?
I've been looking forward to taking care of Raklann.
It's about time.
You'll soon have your chance.
Raklann has renewed his attacks on our Voss allies. One of his chieftains murdered a healer Mystic and the Imperial soldiers protecting her. The Voss are beside themselves with rage.
We broke Raklann's toys, so he's decided to hurt us in return.
This is a deliberate affront.
Beings who can heal any injury are in short supply. It would be careless to lose any more.
A shame. Mystics are useful.
You should have hired pros. Bucketheads aren't trained for protection detail.
Soldiers make bad bodyguards.
Now is hardly the time to be soliciting more business, hunter!
There's few greater tragedies in Voss society than the killing of a Mystic.
Of course they're angry.
How do we respond?
We're not the ones who killed their Mystic.
The Voss shouldn't blame us.
Raklann was cast out because our soldiers destroyed his tribe. To the Voss, we are culpable for his actions now.
The Voss are demanding action. We must placate them, swiftly. Publicly.
Appeasing the Voss is important, but there's no point if Raklann's free to do more damage.
Raklann should be priority.
All things in time.
How, exactly?
Then placate them.
You are all well-known and liked on Voss, your involvement will send the right message.
Your deeds on Voss are well-known; your involvement will send the right message.
There are rumors the Gormak are building a new weapon to use against the Voss. I ordered Captain Ortano to look into it.
And the chieftain responsible for the Mystic's death must be hunted down. If you did these things, it would calm the Voss, freeing us to pursue Raklann.
A Mystic's death is a hard thing to make up for.
Let's hope this works.
If the Voss lose faith in us, our work here has been for nothing.
Leave it with me, Lord Pallas.
Know what calms me? Money.
You will be compensated. Later.
Trivial, but I'll do it.
A last item. There was one survivor from the attack on the Mystic, a Major Kouvar. He claims to have insight into Raklann's plans.
When your business is complete, meet with the major at Pelath Point. Discover what he knows. Then use it to crush Raklann under your heel.
Find Vex Dantos, and that astromech droid, TM-82. They should know more about the situation in the ruins.
A curious region, these marches, don't you think? Among these ruins, the footprints of battles... old and new.
I hope you like fighting Gormak. Raklann's brought several tribes under his banner, and they're proving a real trial to exterminate.
Nothing can withstand the might of a Sith.
Not for me.
We'll make ourselves stronger by defeating them.
It'll be a healthy challenge.
Just let me at them.
I'm afraid it's not that simple.
Gormak aren't difficult to outmaneuver, if you know what you're doing.
Maybe your tactics need work.
I have fought Gormak for years, my friend. But I haven't fought Raklann.
Raklann's the key to all this. I should know everything you do about him.
I want to know about Raklann.
That would be little; he's an outcast Gormak who blames us for his exile. And he's surprisingly cunning.
I thought Raklann's forces were just Gormak warriors. What's the problem?
Why is that?
Raklann's men are using weapons we've never seen before. Unsophisticated, naturally, but they cut through shields and armor very effectively.
I've lost more squads than I care to count to those weapons; unless we deprive Raklann of his technological advantage, we will lose.
If Raklann's weapons are this good, defeating his forces might be difficult.
So I'm at risk, too.
Your equipment appears to be light-years from standard issue; you should fare better than my men.
Where did Raklann get weapons like that in the first place?
Where are these weapons from?
He adapted them from technology he found, as Gormak always do. The question is, what technology did he find?
Not to Gormak, we won't.
There is another anomaly. The ruins in this area--Gormak usually shun and fear such ruins, but Raklann's men study them freely.
I believe his exploration of those ruins may explain his new weapons.
I wouldn't mind investigating those ruins myself.
The ruins interest me, too.
This whole area seems to be covered in old ruins. What was here?
What were these ruins, anyway?
The Pelath-Ri Marches have the remains of both Jedi and Sith structures, many are still a mystery.
I should find out.
And where do I come in?
I would speak to Vex Dantos. He was overseeing a Sith ruin that the Gormak have taken an interest in.
An astromech droid also reported a Republic excavation nearby; if it's a new discovery, it should be secured before Raklann's Gormak raid it.
Best of luck. Oh, and please feel free to annihilate any Gormak forces you run across.
I have much to organize; please excuse me.
